title: Bayern Munich star Robert Lewandowski aims shot at Pep Guardiola over end-of-season conditioning
text:
Robert Lewandowski claims Bayern are better now than under Pep Guardiola (Photo: Bongarts/Getty Images) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Robert Lewandowski has aimed a shot at Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola following their time together at Bayern Munich. 
The Polish striker, who has already plundered 20 goals this term, is in a buoyant mood as FC Hollywood complete their winter training camp. 
Lewa believes the team, while Pep was in charge, consistently fizzled out towards the end of the season and that Carlo Ancelotti has got the team in better shape ahead of the restart to the season. 
"With this camp, we will play even better," Lewandowski explained in their warm-weather camp in Doha. "We will be tactically and conditionally better. 
"In the last two years we have always had problems at the end of the season, even with the conditioning, and many have ended up injured." Guardiola and Lewandowski during last year's winter camp in Doha (Photo: Alex Grimm) Lewandowski feels Bayern ran out of gas to end seasons under Guardiola (Photo: Bongarts/Getty) Read More Pep Guardiola admits he can be too demanding on his Manchester City squad 
Lewandowski believes Bayern, who are three points clear at the top of the table, have weathered early-season struggles due to the constricted pre-season after Euro 2016 and are now in optimum condition. 
"Many of us couldn’t do anything in the summer after the European Championship, but then the games started straight away. 
“I knew that we would have a weak phase because of the short pre-season. Now we’re improving.” poll loading Who will win the Bundesliga? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
